doe,"2018-12-22T04:36:52.63Z","A missed opportunity ","

As an exclusive set for black VIP card holders (the ones who bought the UCS Millennium Falcon early), the set is a nice surprise. It is given away for free by LEGO with any purchase at LEGO.com.

column2: which can be opened and resealed.&nbsp

column4: after the release of the set is in average 89&euro
column5: . Not too bad, if you want to bring the price down of your 75192 investment.

column1: However, seen in the light of LEGO'
column2: s promise for some amazing extras for black VIP card holders, the set disappoints. Imho&nbsp
column3: no effort at all went into the design of the minifig&nbsp

column7: collector who is not a black VIP card holder.&nbsp

column1: LEGO has missed a great opportunity with the release of the 75192 UCS Millennium Falcon. The second radar dish should have been the promised extra for black VIP members instead of having it in the box from the start. It would have been an amazing add on for any Falcon owner
column2: and every other AFOL would have been happy. Another idea with the same result&nbsp
column4: lighting bricks kit for the Falcon. But this of course would have meant additional development of a new system.&nbsp

column1: The frame comes with a dummy VIP card as shown on the brickset.com database picture. The backside of the card features the LEGO Star Wars logo.
My frame is open, built and on my shelf. It is a nice memory from the day I stood in line with many other AFOLs
column2: waiting for the midnight release of 75192. I like to thank LEGO for sending this set and hope that my critique of the set has been helpful. Thanks for reading.
